titles.title: To extend the deadline under the Federal Power Act applicable to the construction of three hydroelectric projects in the State of Arkansas.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Power.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Commerce. H. Rept. 104-315.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 166.

action.text: Mr. Schaefer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

VOTE POSTPONED - At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. McKeon requested the yeas and nays. Pursuant to a previous announcement of the Chair, further proceedings were postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 404 - 0 (Roll no. 789).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 238.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 1/24/1995--Introduced. Authorizes the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, upon the request of a certain licensee, to extend the time required for commencement of construction of three specified hydroelectric projects in the State of Arkansas.
